block.p: Gay life and culture, traditionally a province of major urban centers, is starting to thrive in smaller communities, like Bloomington, Ill., though not without backlash. Page 12.
The Ears of the 92d St. Y
Helaine Geismar Katz is the quintessential New Yorker behind that quintessential New York institution -- the lectures on culture and public affairs at the 92d Street Y. Page 21.
President Jean-Bertrand Aristide of Haiti, a former priest, married a New Yorker with Haitian roots yesterday, but some Haitians were not pleased about it. Page 4.
Gerry Mulligan, a baritone saxophonist and one of the great improvisors of postwar jazz, died at 68. He was a founder of the Cool School of jazz. Page 27.
Playing before a hometown crowd in Melbourne, Mark Philippoussis upset top-ranked Pete Sampras in the third round of the Australian Tennis Open. SportsSunday, section 8.
